title: Heat of Na2S2O3 and NaOCl redox rxn

content.description: <math alttext="N a 2 S 2 O 3 aqueous plus 4 N a O C l aqueous plus 2 N a O H aqueous react to produce 2 N a 2 S O 4 aqueous plus 4 N a C l aqueous plus H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The enthalpy change for the reaction represented by the chemical equation shown above is <math alttext="delta H naught equals negative 1236 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1236</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. When <math alttext="2.00 moles" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N a O C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts completely with an excess of <math alttext="N a 2 S 2 O 3 aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and of <math alttext="N a O H aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following enthalpy changes occurs?

choices.label: <math alttext="618 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>618</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is absorbed.
<math alttext="2470 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2470</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is absorbed.
<math alttext="618 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>618</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is released.
<math alttext="2470 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2470</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is released.

content.answer: <math alttext="618 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>618</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is released.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
